a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Personal remittances and official development assistance received, World, 1960 to 2020
Remittances are financial transfers from non-residents to residents of a country, such as a worker abroad sending money to family and
friends. Official development assistance (ODA) is defined as government aid designed to promote the economic development and welfare of
developing countries. Both are measured in current US$.
Data source: World Bank based on data from the International Monetary Fund, Data compiled from multiple sources by World Bank
